results.title: Sustainable Ouyen
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Several years ago a group of Ouyen Primary School students petitioned their local council to adopt a community-recycling program. To everybody’s surprise the council not only provided an unprecedented household recycling service but did so at a loss. Since that time the community has launched a number of forward thinking initiatives with solar power, sustainable agriculture and improved water usage. Whether it’s the Ouyen Football Club, High School or local farmers, there’s an understanding that sustainable practices must be employed now in order for future Ouyen generations to benefit.

results.title: The Ouyen Taxi Driver
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The town of Ouyen has only one taxi driver. Meet Ross Missen and see the town of Ouyen through his eyes, meet some of his regular customers and learn why locals love him.

results.title: Marion of Colignan
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Peters loves living on the land. Despite having the opportunity of establishing a life in the city, she returned to her hometown to raise a family with her husband Geoff on a 12-hectare organic farm that they developed from scratch. Having overcome droughts, hailstorms and the large financial strain of maintaining a farm, Marion feels that things are finally looking up, with a bumper harvest of apples and promising yields of avocadoes and lemons. Marion is heavily involved in giving back to her community, pivotal in fundraising and ensuring community activities are maintained in a small town with a small population. She believes that it is vital for locals to stay involved and active within their own community.

results.title: Hooked on giving
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: A small but dedicated group of volunteers provide vital emergency service to their local community. Murray Allomes has been the team leader of the Nangiloc/Colignan Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) for 7 years. The small team of volunteers ensure that if an emergency takes place in their district assistance is provided quickly and with care. Despite the serious nature of their role within the community there’s always time for a laugh and a yarn about the strange and wonderful moments they encounter on the job.

results.title: Grapes and wine: a family tradition
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lance Milne is a third generation farmer in Nangiloc-Colignan. He and his wife Marina own a large vineyard in Nangiloc and diversified their business by purchasing one of Mildura’s oldest wineries, Château Mildura. They supply their own grapes and grow citrus. Lance is a passionate horticulturalist and is heavily involved in preserving the important history of wine growing in the Mildura region.

results.title: Celebrations
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A documentary film presenting six different and authentic celebrations involving people in the multicultural community of Melbourne. Depicts an Aboriginal dance showing body decoration preparation, an Indonesian Muslim wedding celebration, an Australian child’s birthday party, a Greek nameday party, Christmas festivities and a Northern Italian Christmas celebration. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Game Masters: Hideo Kojima interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Hideo Kojima speaks about his career as a designer and producer of video games at Konami Digital Entertainment and Kojima Productions. At a time when mainstream action games only focused on attack and defeat, ‘METAL GEAR’ (1987) introduced infiltration into the gameplay and became one of the earliest examples of a stealth game. In 1998, the first 3D title in the ‘Metal Gear’ series, ‘METAL GEAR SOLID’, was released, integrating the most advanced stealth-based gameplay yet seen with cut-scenes that reflected Kojima’s passion for cinema. ‘METAL GEAR SOLID’ became a worldwide best seller and was followed by three successful sequels.

NB: This interview was conducted in Hideo Kojima’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Fumito Ueda interview
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Fumito Ueda may have only two published games but each one has had such an impact that his influence is felt keenly across the industry. Ueda joined Sony Computer Entertainment in 1997 where he developed his first game, ‘ICO’ (2001), a beautifully poetic adventure game based on an abstracted boy-meets-girl premise. Ueda’s next game, ‘Shadow of the Colossus’ (2005) took an opposing theme to ICO’s sacrificial narrative, with the aim being to topple 16 giant mythical beings to restore the life of a girl named Mono.

NB: This interview was conducted in Fumito Ueda’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Blizzard Entertainment interview
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Blizzard Entertainment is a world leading developer and publisher renowned for creating some of the industry’s most critically acclaimed games. Blizzard’s first success was in 1994 with ‘Warcraft: Orcs and Humans’, a game that laid the foundations for the burgeoning real-time strategy genre, introducing gameplay features that would become standards. In 1996 the company released the action-role-playing-game ‘Diablo’. With a track record that includes thirteen number one games and multiple Game of the Year awards, Blizzard Entertainment has gone on to establish one of the largest online followings of any game company worldwide.

The company is best known for the subscription-based massively multiplayer online role-playing games ‘World of Warcraft’ (2004), and ‘StarCraft’ (1998) series. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

Blizzard’s first success was in 1994 with ‘Warcraft: Orcs and Humans’, a game that laid the foundations for the burgeoning real-time strategy genre, introducing gameplay features that would become standards. In 1996 the company released the action-role-playing-game ‘Diablo’. With a track record that includes thirteen number one games and multiple Game of the Year awards, Blizzard Entertainment has gone on to establish one of the largest online followings of any game company worldwide.

The company is best known for the subscription-based massively multiplayer online role-playing games ‘World of Warcraft’ (2004), and ‘StarCraft’ (1998) series. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
